queries.query_usecase: Pre-Cleanup - Drop Test Tables from Previous Run
queries.query_description: Ensures clean state by dropping all test tables from any previous failed run. This prevents 'duplicate column' errors when running the test multiple times.

queries.query_usecase: Create Base Tables for Schema Tampering
queries.query_description: Creates 10 base tables that will be used for ALTER operations in the schema tampering outlier detection test. These tables provide the foundation for demonstrating anomalous schema modification patterns.
Executes 5 ALTER TABLE commands as part of normal baseline activity. This represents typical schema modification behavior that should not trigger anomaly detection.
Executes 5 more ALTER TABLE commands as part of normal baseline activity. Combined with Batch 1, this establishes a baseline of 10 ALTER operations per time period.

queries.query_string: ALTER TABLE schema_alter_table_1 ADD COLUMN spike_col_{INT} VARCHAR(50);
queries.query_description: Executes 100 ALTER TABLE commands in rapid succession, creating an anomalous spike in schema modification activity. This simulates a schema tampering attack or unauthorized bulk schema changes that should trigger outlier detection. The {INT} placeholder generates unique column names for each iteration.

queries.query_string: SELECT table_name, COUNT(*) as column_count FROM information_schema.columns WHERE table_schema = DATABASE() AND table_name LIKE 'schema_alter_table_%' GROUP BY table_name ORDER BY table_name;
queries.query_description: Queries the information_schema to verify the number of columns added to each table during the schema tampering test. Useful for confirming that ALTER operations were executed successfully.
Removes all test tables created during the schema tampering test. This cleanup operation resets the database to its original state and can be run after completing the outlier detection test.
